summary: A letter from The Shubert Organization's Controller, Juan M. Calvo, to an FBI Special Agent in West Palm Beach, responding to a grand jury subpoena (FGJ 07-103 OLY-60) by providing attached records. The document indicates compliance with a subpoena related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Juan M. Calvo
persons.context: Author of the letter responding to an FBI subpoena, providing records on behalf of The Shubert Organization.

persons.name: Special Agent FBI
persons.context: Recipient of the letter and subpoena response, based at the West Palm Beach FBI office.

connections.description: Calvo is responding to the FBI Special Agent's grand jury subpoena on behalf of The Shubert Organization.

events.title: Response to Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: Juan M. Calvo sends records to the FBI in response to grand jury subpoena FGJ 07-103 OLY-60.

locations: 505 S. Flagler Drive Suite 500 West Palm Beach, FL 33401-5944
keyFacts: The Shubert Organization received a grand jury subpoena (FGJ 07-103 OLY-60) from the FBI in West Palm Beach related to the Epstein investigation.
Juan M. Calvo, as Controller, responded by providing records that 'seem to meet the criteria' of the subpoena.
The response was sent via Federal Express on August 8, 2007, indicating ongoing grand jury proceedings at that time.
The document shows organizational compliance with investigative requests during the Epstein case.
The FBI's West Palm Beach office was actively issuing subpoenas in 2007 as part of the Epstein investigation.
